tourBios.curYrHigh: Played in 15 Web.com Tour events, making five cuts...In February and March, made four Web.com Tour starts, playing the weekend in Cartagena, Colombia (T53) and Santiago, Chile (T30)...In April, collected his first eGolf Gateway Tour victory at the Sedgefield Classic in Greensboro, N.C.
tourBios.carHigh: Made the cut in seven out of 17 eGolf Professional Golf Tour events. Finished fifth at the Championship at River Run, with help from a second-round 67. Fired a second-round 61 at the Southern Open, finished the tournament T38.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was a three-time winner of the North Carolina Players Championship…Was a four-year letterman and was a member of a state championship team at R.J. Reynolds High School…Was named conference Player of the Year in high school…Won the Donald Ross Junior Championship and the North Carolina Big I.
tourBios.personal: Full name is Ryan Nicholas Sullivan… Single… Special interests include running… Affiliated to Tanglewood CC in Clemmons, North Carolina… Favorite golf memory was making a hole-in-one at age 6 in a $1-million shootout…Favorite teams are the Atlanta Braves and the North Carolina Tarheels…Twitter account is @RSully1989…Dream foursome would include his dad, Arnold Palmer and Jack Nicklaus…Not many people know he is Irish…Supports the Ronald McDonald House.

tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Additional Qualifying Tournament Finisher or Finished 76-100 on 2014 Web.com Tour Money List
tourBios.curYearHigh: Played in 15 Web.com Tour events, making five cuts...In February and March, made four Web.com Tour starts, playing the weekend in Cartagena, Colombia (T53) and Santiago, Chile (T30)...In April, collected his first eGolf Gateway Tour victory at the Sedgefield Classic in Greensboro, N.C.
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Finished T54 at Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament in December. Shot 66 in the last round...Received a sponsor's exemption to play in the PGA TOUR's Puerto Rico Open in March. Shot 69-70-68-74 to record a T43 finish in his second TOUR start...The following week made his first of 13 Web.com Tour starts, playing in Brazil. Would go on to make seven cuts, with his top performance a T18 at the Cleveland Open in June...Played three Latinoamérica events in a row in the early fall. Made two cuts and finished T44 in the last tournament.

2013: In his first career start on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica, he carded a final round of 7-under-par 65 to win the Puerto Rico Classic in October. The event was shortened to 54 holes due to dangerous weather at the Dorado Beach Resort & Club in Dorado, Puerto Rico. He started the tournament with a double-bogey and was 4-over par through seven holes in the opening round, but came back to shoot 74, 66 and 65 to win by one shot at 11-under-par 205. His uncle, Marty Smith, caddied for him in the tournament. His final round of 65 secured him the OHL-Round of the Week Award as well…Missed the cut in both of his two starts on the Web.com Tour, at the Brasil Classic and at the Mid-Atlantic Championship…Qualified for the U.S. Open at Merion to make his first PGA TOUR event (missed the cut)...Finished T56 at Web.com Tour Q-School in Dec.

2012: Made the cut in seven of 17 eGolf Professional Golf Tour events. Finished fifth at the Championship at River Run, with help from a second-round 67...Fired a second-round 61 at the Southern Open, finished the tournament T38.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was a three-time winner of the North Carolina Players Championship...Was a four-year letterman and a member of a state championship team (3A) at R.J. Reynolds High School. Was North Carolina Invitational individual champion and conference Player of the Year in high school...Won the Donald Ross Junior Championship and the North Carolina Big I.
tourBios.personal: Attended RJR & Forsyth Country Day School...First-tee intro would be "I'm Your Lady" by Celine Dion...Favorite golf memory was making a hole-in-one at age 6 in a $1-million shootout...Other favorites include the North Carolina Tar Heels, the San Antonio Spurs, "Seinfeld, "The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon," "Gladiator," "The Shawshank Redemption," country music and Dwyane Wade...Would like to trade places with Brad Pitt for a day "Because he's Brad Pitt."...Speaks Spanish and some French...Dream foursome would include Fallon, Dave Chappelle and his Uncle Marty...Not many people know he is Irish...If not a golfer, says he would be pro soccer player...Supports the Ronald McDonald House...Twitter account is @rsully1989.

tourBios.curYrHigh: Played in 15 Web.com Tour events, making five cuts...In February and March, made four Web.com Tour starts, playing the weekend in Cartagena, Colombia (T53) and Santiago, Chile (T30)...In April, collected his first eGolf Gateway Tour victory at the Sedgefield Classic in Greensboro, N.C.

tourBios.curYearHigh: Played in 15 Web.com Tour events, making five cuts...In February and March, made four Web.com Tour starts, playing the weekend in Cartagena, Colombia (T53) and Santiago, Chile (T30)...In April, collected his first eGolf Gateway Tour victory at the Sedgefield Classic in Greensboro, N.C.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was T18th in 2014 at the Cleveland Open.
